New Records: Freddie Freeman hit a two-run single to tie the Series record of 12 RBIs, set by Bobby Richardson over seven games in 1960
Key Match Events: Errors by Judge in center and Anthony Volpe at shortstop, combined with pitcher Gerrit Cole failing to cover first on Betts' grounder, helped Los Angeles score five unearned runs in the fifth
Aaron Judge and Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit back-to-back home runs in the first inning for New York
Gavin Lux and Mookie Betts hit eighth-inning sacrifice flies to beat New York 7-6
Pre-Game Insights: In spring training this is what we said we were going to do and we did it
We were like just get one, chip away, chip away
Post-Match Reflections: This is going to sting forever
We faced every adversity possible and we overcame every single one
It's going to be emotional for all of us
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers earned their eighth championship and seventh since leaving Brooklyn for Los Angeles â€” their first in a non-shortened season since 1988
New York remained without a title since its record 27th in 2009
The Dodgers will celebrate with a parade Friday on what would have been the 64th birthday for Dodgers great Fernando Valenzuela
